page.title: 08The Antique Shop, Bridgerule
page.content: Quite surprisingly, for Bridgerule is a very small place indeed, there is a small but well established antique shop right in the centre of the village and opposite the local inn. The owners have lived in Bridgerule since 1938 and one of the partners attended the village school and notes many changes which have occured in subsequent years. The shop itself was built in 1921. Before this there was just a cottage in which a lady lived whose trade was dressmaking. Having established their small antique trade, the present owners extended and fully modernised the building which now provides them with a comfortable home and steady income. Until recently, the present owner was the representative for the local press ensuring that all items of interest were recorded and published.
